intro: Prostanthera violacea var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered mint bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are often fragrant and have a mint-like scent, typical of the genus Prostanthera. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
